skill.name: data-analysis
skill.description: A skill for analyzing data using Python (pandas) and generating professional visualizations (matplotlib/seaborn).
skill.summary: Generate data analysis code and visualizations using Python pandas and matplotlib in sandbox environments
skill.author: BOHUYESHAN-APB

security_audit.summary: The skill generates Python code for data analysis but does not execute it directly. Static findings flagged API key access and string operations, but all patterns are false positives. The skill reads configuration from environment variables for OpenAI API access, which is standard practice for LLM-based code generation. No actual command execution occurs within the skill code.

low_findings.title: Environment Variable Access for API Configuration
low_findings.description: The skill reads OPENAI_API_KEY and OPENAI_BASE_URL from environment variables to configure the OpenAI client. This is standard practice for API integration and does not pose a security risk as the skill does not transmit these values to unauthorized endpoints.

content.user_title: Generate Data Analysis and Visualization Code
content.value_statement: Data analysis often requires custom Python code for specific datasets and visualization needs. This skill uses AI to generate tailored pandas and matplotlib code that processes your data and creates professional charts in sandbox environments.
actual_capabilities: Generate Python code for data analysis using pandas library
Create visualization code with matplotlib and seaborn
Apply professional styling and color palettes to charts
Parse and extract Python code blocks from AI responses
Configure OpenAI API client for code generation tasks
Support multiple chart types including bar, line, scatter, pie, and heatmap
limitations: Does not execute generated code directly, requires external sandbox environment
Depends on OpenAI API availability and configuration
Generated code quality depends on the clarity of input requirements
Limited to pandas and matplotlib ecosystem, no support for other visualization libraries

use_cases.title: Business Analytics Dashboard
use_cases.description: Generate Python code to process sales data from CSV files and create multi-panel dashboards with revenue trends, regional comparisons, and product performance charts.

use_cases.title: Research Data Visualization
use_cases.description: Create publication-ready charts from experimental data with consistent professional styling and color schemes that match academic standards.

use_cases.title: Automated Report Generation
use_cases.description: Build scripts that automatically analyze datasets and generate visual summaries for recurring reports without manual coding effort.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Chart Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate code to create a bar chart showing monthly sales from a CSV file with columns: month, revenue

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Variable Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a scatter plot with regression line showing the relationship between advertising spend and sales, colored by region

prompt_templates.title: Time Series Visualization
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a line chart with multiple series showing daily temperature, humidity, and pressure over the past month with professional styling

prompt_templates.title: Advanced Statistical Plot
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a heatmap showing correlations between 10 different product categories, with annotations and a custom color palette matching corporate branding

output_examples.input: Create a bar chart showing quarterly revenue
output_examples.output: Generated Python script imports pandas and matplotlib, loads data, creates a styled bar chart with labeled axes and saves output to chart_output.png

output_examples.input: Plot temperature trends over time with error bars
output_examples.output: Complete Python code with pandas data processing, matplotlib time series plot with confidence intervals, and professional theme applied

output_examples.input: Build a pie chart showing market share distribution
output_examples.output: Python script that calculates percentages, creates a pie chart with custom colors from the professional palette, and exports high-resolution image

best_practices: Provide clear data context including column names, data types, and sample values for accurate code generation
Specify exact chart type and styling requirements to get code that matches your needs on first generation
Review generated code in a sandbox environment before using it with sensitive data to verify correctness
anti_patterns: Using vague requirements like 'analyze my data' without specifying the analysis type or visualization needed
Executing generated code without reviewing it first, which may lead to unexpected errors or incorrect results
Requesting complex multi-step analyses in a single prompt instead of breaking them into smaller, testable components

faq.question: Does this skill execute the Python code it generates?
faq.answer: No, this skill only generates Python code. You need to execute the code in a separate sandbox environment with pandas and matplotlib installed.

faq.question: What chart types are supported?
faq.answer: The skill can generate code for bar charts, line charts, scatter plots, pie charts, heatmaps, and other matplotlib and seaborn visualizations.

faq.question: Do I need an OpenAI API key to use this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill requires OpenAI API credentials configured through environment variables or the skill configuration to generate code using GPT-4.

faq.question: Can I customize the visual style of generated charts?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill includes a professional theme with custom color palettes. You can specify styling requirements in your prompts.

faq.question: What format does the generated code output?
faq.answer: The generated code saves visualizations as PNG files with high DPI resolution suitable for reports and presentations.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use with sensitive data?
faq.answer: The skill sends data context to OpenAI API for code generation. Avoid including sensitive data in prompts if you have data privacy concerns.
